data.title: What are the best movies on Disney+ to watch right now?
data.meta_description: NOW that coronavirus lockdowns have made us spend more time indoors, there are plenty of shows on Disney+ to help pass the time. The streaming platform has a wide variety of dramas, rom-coms, class…
data.text:
NOW that coronavirus lockdowns have made us spend more time indoors, there are plenty of shows on Disney+ to help pass the time.

The streaming platform has a wide variety of dramas, rom-coms, classics and comedies for all to enjoy.

Take a look at some of the top Disney+ movies.

1. National Treasure (2004)

National Treasure is a series of historical adventures starring Nicolas Cage as Benjamin Gates, a treasure hunter who, with the help of his father, his girlfriend, and his loyal sidekick, uncover hidden troves and secrets from US history while evading the US Government.

Rotten Tomatoes rating: 46%

2. Who Framed Roger Rabbit (1988)

The 1988 American live-action/animated comedy is loosely based on Gary K. Wolf's 1981 novel Who Censored Roger Rabbit?

The film stars Bob Hoskins, Christopher Lloyd, Charles Fleischer, Stubby Kaye, and Joanna Cassidy.

Set in 1947 version of Hollywood where cartoon characters and people coexist, the film follows Eddie Valiant, a private detective who must exonerate Roger Rabbit, a "Toon" (cartoon character) who is accused of murdering a wealthy businessman.

Rotten Tomatoes rating: 97%

3. Hamilton (2020)

The original Broadway production of the award-winning musical tells the story of Alexander Hamilton, first secretary of the treasury.

The show blends Hip-Hop, Jazz, R&B and Broadway styles, filmed from the Richard Rogers Theater in New York.

It features Lin-Manuel Miranda, Leslie Odom Jr. and Broadway’s Thomas Kail and Jeffrey Seller.

Rotten Tomatoes rating: 98%

4. Black Panther (2018)

The superhero film si based on the Black Panther Marvel comics and stars Michael B. Jordan, Lupita Nyong’o and Martin Freeman.

In Black Panther, the main character, T'Challa is crowned king of Wakanda following his father's death, but he is challenged by villain Killmonger, who plans to abandon the country's isolationist policies and begin a global revolution.

Rotten Tomatoes rating: 96%

5. Star Wars: The Last Jedi (2017)

The Last Jedi is the second installment of the Star Wars sequel trilogy, following The Force Awakens, and it is the eighth episode of the nine-part "Skywalker saga."

The movie follows Rey as she seeks the aid of Luke Skywalker, in hopes of turning the tide for the Resistance in the fight against Kylo Ren and the First Order, while General Leia Organa, Finn, and Poe Dameron attempt to escape a First Order attack on the dwindling Resistance fleet.

It stars Mark Hammill, Carrie Fisher, Daisy Ridley and Adam Driver.

Rotten Tomatoes rating: 90%

6. High School Musical (2006)

High School Musical is the first installment of a three part story that follows the life of two high school juniors from rival stereotypical cliques starring Zac Efron, Vanessa Hudgens and Ashley Tisdale.

Efron stars as Troy Bolton, a basketball team captain, and Hudgens plays Gabriella Montez, a shy transfer student excelling in math and science.

Troy and Gabriella try out for the lead parts in their high school musical, causing drama among the student body.

Despite their classmates' attempts to thwart their dreams, Troy and Gabriella aim to resist peer pressure and rivalry and wish to inspire others along the way not to "stick to the status quo."

Rotten Tomatoes rating: 63%

7. Beauty and the Beast (1991)

The animated film focuses on a prince who is cursed and turns into a monster and his servants, who have been transformed into household objects as punishment for his arrogance.

Beast imprisons Belle, a young woman who lived with her father, in his castle.

To break the curse, Beast must win Belle's heart before the last petal falls from an enchanted rose - or else he'll remain a monster forever.

Rotten tomatoes rating: 94%

8. The Rocketeer (1991)

The superhero film stars Bill Campbell, Alan Arkin and Jennifer Connelly.

It tells the story of stunt pilot Cliff Secord, who stumbled upon a secret rocket-powered jet pack he uses to zip through the skies.

His deeds attract the attention of Howard Hughes and the FBI, who are hunting for the missing jet pack, as well as the Nazi operatives who stole it from Hughes.

Rotten Tomatoes rating: 65%

9. The Lion King (1994)

The animated film tells the story of Simba, a lion who is to succeed his father Mufasa as King of the Pride Lands.

After Simba's paternal uncle Scar murders Mufasa, he's manipulated into thinking he was responsible for his father's death and leaves Pride Land.

After growing up with carefree outcasts Timon and Pumbaa, Simba runs into his childhood friend, Nala, and his shaman, Rafiki, who impart their wisdom through valuable life lessons.

Simba returns home to challenge Scar to end his tyranny and take his place upon Pride Rock as the rightful King.

Rotten tomatoes rating: 93%

10. Inside Out (2015)

Set in the mind of a young girl named Riley, five personified emotions—Joy, Sadness, Anger, Fear, and Disgust try to help her through life as she and her parents move from Minnesota to San Francisco.

Mindy Kaling, Amy Poehler, Bill Hader, Phyllis Smith and Lewis Black lend their voices to the film.

Rotten tomatoes rating: 98%

11. Coco (2017)

Coco follows a 12-year-old boy named Miguel who is accidentally transported to the Land of the Dead.

There, he seeks the help of his deceased musician great-great-grandfather to return him to his family among the living and to reverse his family's ban on music.

The film is based on the Mexican holiday, Day of the Dead.

Gael Garcia Bernal, Alanna Ulbach and Anthony Gonzalez star as the voices of some of the characters in the film.

Rotten Tomatoes rating: 97%

12. Camp Rock (2008)

The Disney channel original starring Demi Lovato and The Jonas Brothers follows the life of Mitchie, a young girl aspiring to be a singer, and her time at Camp Rock.

While there, she attends a summer music camp, where she will discover friends, adversaries, romance, and her voice.

The film is followed by its sequel, Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam.

Rotten Tomatoes rating: 45%

13. Home Alone (1990)

The Christmas comedy film starrs Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, John Heard, and Catherine O'Hara.

The film follows Kevin, an eight-year-old boy, who must defend his home from two burglars, Harry and Marv after his family mistakenly leaves him behind on their Christmas vacation.

It is followed by a sequel, Home Alone 2: Lost in New York which premiered in 1992.

Rotten Tomatoes rating: 65%

14. 10 Things I Hate About You (1999)

This romantic comedy is an adaptation of William Shakespeare's late-16th-century comedy The Taming of the Shrew.

It is retold in a late-1990s American high school setting following a new student Cameron who is smitten with Bianca.

In order to get around her father's strict rules on dating, Cameron attempts to get bad boy Patrick to date Bianca's ill-tempered sister, Kat.

The film is titled after a poem written by Kat about her bittersweet romance with Patrick.

It stars the late Heath Ledger, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Julia Stiles and Larisa Oleynik.

Rotten Tomatoes rating: 69%

15. Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl (2003)

The Curse of the Black Pearl is part of the Pirates of the Caribbean film series which follows pirate Jack Sparrow, and blacksmith Will Turner as they rescue the kidnapped Elizabeth Swann from the cursed crew of the Black Pearl.

The film stars Johnny Depp, Orlando Bloom and Kiera Knightley.

It is one of the fourth-highest grossing films of 2003.

Rotten Tomatoes rating: 79%

16. Avatar (2009)

Directed by Titanic’s James Cameron, the Sci-Fi film set in the mid-22nd century when humans are colonizing Pandora, a lush habitable moon of a gas giant in the Alpha Centauri star system, in order to mine the mineral unobtanium, a room-temperature superconductor.

The expansion of the mining colony threatens the continued existence of a local tribe of Na'vi – a humanoid species indigenous to Pandora.

The film's title refers to a genetically engineered Na'vi body operated from the brain of a remotely located human that is used to interact with the natives of Pandora.

It stars Zoe Saldana, Sam Worthington, and Sigourney Weaver.

It grossed over $749M dollars since its worldwide release.

Rotten Tomatoes rating: 82%

17. Hocus Pocus (1993)

Hocus Pocus is usually streamed during Halloween season to celebrate Fall festivities.

The film follows a villainous comedic trio of witches who are inadvertently resurrected by a teenage boy in Salem, Massachusetts, on Halloween night.

It stars Bette Midler, Sarah Jessica Parker and Kathy Najimi as the witches.

Rotten Tomatoes rating: 34%

18. X-Men (2000)

X-Men is a superhero series based on Marvel’s comic books created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby.

There are 12 films that are part of the series.

X-Men 2000 introduces Logan and Rogue into the conflict between Professor Xavier's X-Men and the Brotherhood of Mutants, led by Magneto.

Magneto intends to mutate world leaders at a United Nations summit with a machine he has built to bring about acceptance of mutantkind, but he was not aware that this forced mutation will result only in their deaths.

Rotten Tomatoes rating: 81%

19. Snow White (1937)

Snow White is an animated Disney princess film based on the 1812 German fairy tale by the Brothers Grimm.

Snow White is a lonely princess living with her stepmother, a vain Queen.

The Queen worries that Snow White will be more beautiful than her, so she forces Snow White to work as a scullery maid and asks her Magic Mirror daily "who is the fairest one of all".

For years the mirror always answers that the Queen is, pleasing her.

Snow White meets seven dwarfs who help her and watch over her as she is presumed dead.

Only a true love’s kiss by the town Prince can revive her of her deep slumber.

In 1989, the United States Library of Congress deemed the film "culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant" and selected it as one of the first 25 films for preservation in the National Film Registry.

Rotten Tomates rating: 98%

20. Toy Story 3 (2010)

Toy Story 3 is part of a Pixar animated series.

The plot focuses on Woody, Buzz Lightyear, and Andy's other remaining toys accidentally being donated to a daycare center.

Meanwhile, a now 17-years-old Andy prepares to leave for college, and their ensuing race to get home before Andy leaves.

It features the voices of Joan Cusack, Tom Hanks, Tim Allen and the late Don Rickles.
